RxKonet is designed to streamline pharmacy operations, enhance patient engagement, and optimize service delivery. Below are the core features and key benefits that make RxKonet a powerful tool for modern pharmacies.

RxKonet is a comprehensive digital health platform designed to help pharmacies streamline operations, enhance patient engagement, and optimize service delivery. By leveraging automation and real-time analytics, RxKonet enables pharmacies to deliver efficient, data-driven, and personalized care.
RxKonet is designed to be lightweight and accessible. You don‚Äôt need high-end hardware‚Äîjust a stable internet connection and a compatible device.

Learn how to group clients based on medical conditions, demographics, or specific needs to facilitate personalized communication and better patient management.
Learn how to register and manage client profiles in RxKonet efficiently. This section provides a step-by-step guide to registering new clients and ensuring their information is correctly recorded.

The Client Requests feature allows pharmacies to track medication or product requests made by clients. When a client requests an unavailable product, the pharmacy can log the request, update its status, and notify the client once the item is available.

Learn how to search, filter, and manage client records in RxKonet efficiently. This section covers how to access registered clients, customize the view, perform quick actions, and manage client history.
Learn how to update and modify client information in RxKonet to ensure accurate and up-to-date records.
RxKonet allows you to schedule automated SMS reminders to keep clients informed and reduce missed visits.
Use the Send SMS feature in RxKonet to send appointment reminders, alerts, or follow-up instructions directly to clients via text message.
Learn how to create and manage reusable SMS message templates for communicating with clients. RxKonet supports two types of templates:

RxKonet allows you to record, view, and manage diagnostic tests such as blood pressure, glucose, malaria, and more. This helps in maintaining accurate clinical records and supporting treatment decisions.
Learn how to create, document, and manage patient encounters in RxKonet to ensure accurate medical records and effective follow-up care.
Learn how to schedule, track, and manage follow-ups for clients in RxKonet. Follow-ups help ensure consistent care, improve adherence, and reduce missed appointments.
Learn how to access and manage previously recorded encounters in RxKonet.
Learn how to track key metrics, generate reports, and analyze trends in RxKonet to improve operational efficiency and patient care.
RxKonet allows you to quickly add, view, and manage a patient's medications without creating a full encounter. This feature is useful for prescription updates and medication history tracking.
Your discovery call is a personalized session designed to understand your pharmacy's needs and demonstrate how RxKonet can help optimize your workflow.
This session includes a structured walkthrough of RxKonet, covering your specific pain points, system capabilities, and customization options.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Introduction (5 minutes) Meet your RxKonet representative. Overview of what will be covered. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Understanding Your Needs (15 minutes) Discussion of your current workflow and challenges. Identifying key pain points. Aligning RxKonet with your goals and expectations. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Live Demo (25 minutes) Core features showcase ‚Äì How RxKonet streamlines pharmacy operations. Customization options ‚Äì Tailoring the system to fit your needs. Real-world examples ‚Äì How pharmacies like yours are using RxKonet. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Q&A Session (15 minutes) Address any questions or concerns. Discuss specific customization or integration needs. Outline next steps in the onboarding process.

üî≤ List your current challenges ‚Äì Identify specific workflow inefficiencies. üî≤ Prepare questions about features ‚Äì Clarify any functionality concerns. üî≤ Note down specific requirements ‚Äì Think about customization needs. üî≤ Have basic pharmacy info ready ‚Äì Location, size, key team members. üí° Make the Most of Your Demo Share specific scenarios you'd like to see demonstrated to ensure a tailored experience.
The onboarding process ensures your pharmacy is properly set up, and your team is fully trained to use RxKonet effectively.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Agreement Signing Review and accept service terms. Understand data privacy policies. Complete the digital signature process. 2Ô∏è‚É£ System Setup Create your RxKonet account. Configure branches and locations. Set up user roles and permissions. Customize initial settings based on pharmacy needs. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Staff Training Access training materials for onboarding. Attend live training sessions with experts. Use a practice environment to explore RxKonet safely.

After onboarding, you will have access to: ‚úÖ 24/7 Help Desk for technical support. ‚úÖ Comprehensive Knowledge Base with guides and FAQs. ‚úÖ Regular Check-ins to address feedback and improvements. ‚úÖ Update Notifications for new features and enhancements. üöÄ Ready to Go Live? Once training is complete, our team will help you plan your official go-live date!
Getting started with RxKonet is quick, guided, and hassle-free. Follow these simple steps to register and gain access to the platform.
You can start your registration through two easy options: üåê Online Registration ‚Äì Fill out our quick form. üë• Personal Contact ‚Äì Connect with our team via email at admin@rxkonet.com.

To complete your registration, ensure you have the following details ready: üè™ Pharmacy Name & License Details ‚Äì Required for verification. üìç Branch Locations & Addresses ‚Äì List of all pharmacy locations. üë§ Primary Contact Person ‚Äì Name and designation of the main point of contact. ‚è∞ Operating Hours ‚Äì Store hours for better coordination. üìû Contact Information ‚Äì Email and phone number for communication. üöÄ Speed Up Your Registration! Having these details ready in advance will streamline your registration process and minimize delays.

Once you submit your registration: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Application Review ‚Äì Our team reviews your details for accuracy. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Discovery Call ‚Äì We schedule a short onboarding call. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Access Granted ‚Äì You receive login credentials to complete your setup.
If you need assistance at any point during the registration process, our support team is ready to help! üìß Contact Support: admin@rxkonet.com üìû Call Us: +233 596571975

RxKonet is designed to streamline pharmacy operations, enhance patient engagement, and optimize service delivery. Below are the core features and key benefits that make RxKonet a powerful tool for modern pharmacies.
RxKonet provides four essential features that drive efficiency, engagement, and data-driven decision-making.

Quick patient registration in under two minutes. Secure record storage, including visit history, medical details, and demographics. Group clients based on conditions (e.g., diabetic, hypertensive) for targeted messaging. Comprehensive patient profiles, including emergency contacts and insurance details.

Structured visit records to track consultations and diagnoses. Seamless documentation of complaints, tests, and treatments. Automated follow-up reminders for post-consultation check-ins. Accessible digital patient history to ensure continuity of care.

Personalized SMS reminders for medication refills and follow-ups. Scheduled and recurring messages (e.g., monthly health tips, festive greetings). Targeted outreach to specific patient groups for better engagement. Predefined message templates for faster and more efficient communication.

Patient engagement tracking ‚Äì Monitor follow-ups, refill adherence, and retention rates. Medication refill trends ‚Äì Optimize service delivery based on prescription patterns. Impact analysis ‚Äì Assess the effectiveness of reminders and interventions. Data-driven decision-making ‚Äì Improve pharmacy operations and growth strategies.
RxKonet empowers pharmacies by automating workflows, improving patient engagement, and providing actionable insights.
‚úÖ Reduce manual workload through automation. ‚úÖ Centralized digital records for easy access and tracking. ‚úÖ Streamlined consultation and follow-up processes for better workflow.
‚úÖ Timely reminders to improve medication adherence. ‚úÖ Personalized communication to build stronger patient relationships. ‚úÖ Targeted outreach to educate and engage patients effectively.
‚úÖ Analytics-based insights to optimize pharmacy services. ‚úÖ Trends and performance tracking for better service quality. ‚úÖ Predictive planning for medication demand and client needs.

RxKonet is built to help pharmacies automate, engage, and grow in a competitive healthcare landscape. üöÄ Want to learn more? Explore RxKonet‚Äôs Client Management and Encounter Documentation features in detail.

RxKonet is a comprehensive digital health platform designed to help pharmacies streamline operations, enhance patient engagement, and optimize service delivery. By leveraging automation and real-time analytics, RxKonet enables pharmacies to deliver efficient, data-driven, and personalized care.
Register new patients in under two minutes. Store essential details such as name, contact information, medical history, and visit reasons.
Maintain organized digital health records. Track consultations, diagnostic tests, and treatment plans to ensure continuity of care.
Send personalized SMS reminders for medication refills, follow-ups, and general health check-ins. Automate recurring communications for patient engagement.
Gain real-time insights into patient engagement, refill adherence, and pharmacy performance. Use data-driven reports to improve operational efficiency.

RxKonet simplifies patient engagement through automated messaging: ‚úÖ Refill Reminders ‚Äì Notify patients when it‚Äôs time to refill prescriptions, reducing missed doses. ‚úÖ Follow-up Reminders ‚Äì Automate post-consultation reminders to enhance continuity of care. ‚úÖ Scheduled Messages ‚Äì Set up recurring communications for check-ins, festive greetings, and health awareness campaigns. ‚úÖ Targeted Messaging ‚Äì Group patients by medical condition (e.g., diabetics, hypertensives) to send customized health updates.

Watch this high-level overview of RxKonet and its core functionalities: üí° Why Choose RxKonet? RxKonet is more than just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a smart solution that helps pharmacies automate workflows, improve efficiency, and enhance patient care.
RxKonet is designed to be lightweight and accessible. You don‚Äôt need high-end hardware‚Äîjust a stable internet connection and a compatible device.
Any modern computer (Windows, macOS, or Linux). Recommended screen resolution: 1366 x 768 or higher for the best experience.
Android: Version 8.0 (Oreo, 2017) or newer. iPhone: iOS 13.0 (2019) or newer.
üîó Connectivity Requirement A steady internet connection is required to use RxKonet. Even a basic home or mobile network will work fine.

For the best experience, use one of the following modern browsers: ‚úÖ Google Chrome (latest version) ‚úÖ Microsoft Edge (latest version) ‚úÖ Safari (latest version) ‚úÖ Mozilla Firefox (latest version) üîπ Other Chromium-based browsers (such as Brave or Opera) may work but are not officially tested.

‚öôÔ∏è Ensure These Are Enabled For RxKonet to function properly, your browser should have: ‚úÖ Cookies enabled ‚Äì To store session data. ‚úÖ JavaScript enabled ‚Äì For full functionality. These settings are enabled by default in most modern browsers.

A collection of key terms used in RxKonet to help users understand system functionalities.
A documented interaction between pharmacy staff and a client, including consultations, prescriptions, or other services.
A physical location or unit of the pharmacy organization within the RxKonet system.
Categories used to organize clients based on specific criteria or characteristics.
A scheduled reminder or future interaction with a client.
Stock management system for tracking medications and supplies.
Access rights granted to staff members, determining their system capabilities.
A digital record containing user or client information.
Generated documents showing pharmacy performance metrics and analytics.
A security feature requiring two forms of verification for account access.

The Go-Live process ensures a smooth transition to RxKonet, minimizing disruptions while maximizing efficiency.

Ensure all key setup tasks are completed before going live: üî≤ System configuration verified ‚Äì Ensure all pharmacy settings are properly configured. üî≤ Staff training completed ‚Äì Confirm all team members are trained on their roles. üî≤ Test data reviewed ‚Äì Validate sample patient records and workflows. üî≤ User accounts activated ‚Äì Ensure all staff members have access. üî≤ Backup procedures confirmed ‚Äì Implement data protection measures.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Morning Setup ‚úÖ Verify system access for all users. ‚úÖ Conduct a staff briefing to review workflows. ‚úÖ Keep the support team on standby for assistance. 2Ô∏è‚É£ During the Day ‚úÖ Monitor system performance in real-time. ‚úÖ Provide immediate support for any technical issues. ‚úÖ Track and document any concerns for resolution. 3Ô∏è‚É£ End of Day ‚úÖ Conduct a performance review of the launch. ‚úÖ Verify all data accuracy and system functionality. ‚úÖ Collect staff feedback for improvements. üõ†Ô∏è Launch Support Our team will be available throughout launch day to ensure a seamless transition!
After going live, RxKonet provides ongoing support and optimization to ensure continued success.
24/7 Help Desk for urgent issues. üìß Email: support@rxkonet.com üìû Phone: 1-800-RXKONET üí¨ Live Chat: Available directly in the app.
‚úÖ Regular check-ins to address concerns. ‚úÖ Performance monitoring to track efficiency. ‚úÖ System optimization for better workflows. ‚úÖ Additional training if needed.

‚úÖ Feature updates ‚Äì Stay up to date with new capabilities. ‚úÖ System enhancements ‚Äì Improve efficiency based on feedback. ‚úÖ Performance optimization ‚Äì Ensure smooth operations. ‚úÖ User feedback implementation ‚Äì Prioritize pharmacy needs.
Setting up RxKonet for your pharmacy is quick and straightforward. Follow this step-by-step guide to ensure a smooth onboarding experience.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Main Account Setup Create your pharmacy profile. Configure branch accounts (if applicable). Define user roles and permissions for staff. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Pharmacy Details Enter business information (name, license details). Set up location settings for multiple branches. Define operating hours to reflect store schedules. List services offered (e.g., consultations, refills).

If you have existing records, we can help you import them into RxKonet: ‚úÖ Client records ‚Äì Transfer patient data seamlessly. ‚úÖ Service history ‚Äì Maintain past consultation logs. ‚úÖ Product catalogs ‚Äì Upload medication inventory. ‚úÖ Staff information ‚Äì Configure team roles and access.

Tailor RxKonet to fit your pharmacy's workflow: ‚úÖ Set communication preferences for automated reminders. ‚úÖ Customize report templates for analytics and tracking. ‚úÖ Define follow-up schedules for patient engagement. ‚úÖ Adjust notification settings for alerts and updates. ‚è≥ Setup Timeline Most pharmacies complete their initial setup within one business day!

Use this checklist to ensure everything is configured correctly before going live: üî≤ Provide pharmacy details (business name, location). üî≤ Configure user roles (admin, pharmacist, assistant). üî≤ Set operating hours for accurate scheduling. üî≤ Import existing data (if needed). üî≤ Customize system settings (reports, notifications, follow-ups). üî≤ Verify all configurations before launching.
This section provides quick troubleshooting steps for common issues related to login, encounter records, communication, reports, and user management.

üîç Possible Causes:‚Äã Incorrect credentials Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) issues Account lockout due to multiple failed attempts ‚úÖ Solutions:‚Äã Verify Credentials Double-check your email address and password. Ensure Caps Lock is off. Use "Forgot Password" if unsure. Fix 2FA Issues Check spam folder for the verification code. Ensure you have access to your registered phone/email. Request a new 2FA code if needed. üîê Password Reset Click "Forgot Password" on the login page to reset your password.

üîç Possible Causes:‚Äã Filters hiding records Unsaved data from previous sessions Incorrect client profile selection ‚úÖ Solutions:‚Äã 1Ô∏è‚É£ Check Filter Settings Records & Encounters ‚Üì Clear Filters ‚Üì Adjust Date Range ‚Üì Verify Branch Selection 2Ô∏è‚É£ Verify Save Status Check the client‚Äôs profile for recent encounters. Ensure the record was saved successfully. If unsure, attempt to re-enter and save the record.

üîç Possible Causes:‚Äã Incorrect message scheduling Disabled communication settings Insufficient SMS/email credits ‚úÖ Solutions:‚Äã Verify Message Schedule Confirm date/time settings. Double-check recipient details. Review the message status. Check Communication Settings Navigate to Settings > Communication Settings. Ensure email/SMS notifications are enabled. Verify that the account has sufficient credits for SMS messages.

üîç Possible Causes:‚Äã Strict filter restrictions preventing data display High system load affecting report generation Insufficient data access permissions ‚úÖ Solutions:‚Äã Adjust Report Filters Broaden the date range to include more data. Remove unnecessary filters for better results. Try clearing cache and refreshing the page. System Check Retry report generation after a few minutes. If handling large data sets, generate smaller reports first. Contact support if the issue persists.

üîç Possible Causes:‚Äã Insufficient permissions to create new users Plan restrictions limiting the number of users/branches System constraints affecting user role assignments ‚úÖ Solutions:‚Äã Verify Permissions Ensure you have admin rights to manage users. Review role settings under Settings > Staff Management. If necessary, contact your system administrator for access. Check Plan Limits Review your current subscription plan for user/branch limits. If needed, consider an upgrade to increase capacity. Check usage statistics to see if you've reached a limit.

documents.t: If your issue isn‚Äôt listed here or persists despite troubleshooting: üìß Contact Support: admin@rxkonet.com üìû Call Us: +233 596571975
Your feedback helps us enhance RxKonet by improving features, user experience, and system performance. Choose a feedback channel that works best for you.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Access the Form Navigate to the Help section. Click "Provide Feedback". Fill out the required fields. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Submit Details Describe your experience or issue. Rate specific features. Suggest potential improvements.

Email: admin@rxkonet.com Include in your email: üì∏ Screenshots to illustrate your feedback. üè∑Ô∏è Examples of the issue or feature request. üîç Use cases explaining how improvements would help. üìû Contact information for follow-up if needed.

‚úâÔ∏è Regular email surveys sent to active users. üìã In-app questionnaires for quick input. ‚≠ê Feature-specific feedback collection. üéØ User experience reviews to enhance navigation and usability.
Drives new feature implementation. Enhances existing tools based on real-world use. Helps prioritize system updates based on user demand.

Optimizes platform performance for smooth operation. Improves usability and navigation. Fixes bugs and refines key features. üìå Effective Feedback The more specific and detailed your feedback, the better we can address your needs!
Our comprehensive training program ensures your team can confidently use RxKonet from day one.
RxKonet offers structured training modules tailored to different staff roles.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Basic Navigation‚Äã ‚úÖ System Login ‚Äì Secure access setup. ‚úÖ Dashboard Overview ‚Äì Key insights at a glance. ‚úÖ Menu Navigation ‚Äì Finding essential features quickly. ‚úÖ Quick Actions ‚Äì Performing daily tasks efficiently. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Role-Based Training‚Äã Each team member receives training specific to their role:
‚úÖ Client Registration ‚Äì Adding new patients seamlessly. ‚úÖ Appointment Scheduling ‚Äì Managing bookings and time slots. ‚úÖ Basic Record Management ‚Äì Updating and maintaining patient details.

‚úÖ Encounter Documentation ‚Äì Recording consultations and treatments. ‚úÖ Treatment Plans ‚Äì Managing prescriptions and interventions. ‚úÖ Follow-Up Management ‚Äì Scheduling reminders and tracking adherence.
‚úÖ Report Generation ‚Äì Analyzing pharmacy performance. ‚úÖ Staff Management ‚Äì Assigning roles and permissions. ‚úÖ Performance Monitoring ‚Äì Tracking key metrics and staff productivity.
Choose the training format that works best for your team:
‚úÖ Interactive group training for real-time learning. ‚úÖ Live Q&A to address specific questions. ‚úÖ Hands-on exercises with guided practice. ‚úÖ Screen sharing for step-by-step demonstrations.

‚úÖ Video tutorials covering all major features. ‚úÖ Step-by-step guides for easy reference. ‚úÖ Practice exercises to reinforce learning. ‚úÖ Knowledge checks to assess understanding. üìù Training Resources All training materials remain accessible for future reference so your team can revisit them anytime!

Call Us: +233 596571975 Hours: 9 AM - 6 PM (Monday - Friday) Priority Support available for urgent issues
Response Time: Within 4 hours Examples: System outage Data access problems Security concerns
Response Time: Within 24 hours Examples: Feature inquiries Configuration assistance General guidance
Monday to Friday: 9 AM - 6 PM Full Service Available
Limited availability Urgent issues only Response time may vary üöÄ Best Practice For faster resolution, always include your pharmacy name and specific error messages when contacting support.

For better tracking and faster resolution, submit a ticket through our official support form: üìå Submit a Ticket Here You will be required to provide: A brief description of the issue Priority level Screenshots (if applicable) Pharmacy/Branch name Best Practice For faster resolution, always include your pharmacy name, specific error messages, and steps to reproduce when contacting support.
You can aslo submit a request directly in this form below:
Stay informed about the latest RxKonet updates, improvements, and upcoming features.

‚úÖ Client Groups Management ‚Äì Organize clients into groups for better segmentation and service customization. ‚úÖ Client Requests Module ‚Äì Clients can now make service requests for medications, improving communication efficiency. ‚úÖ Bug Fixes & Performance Enhancements ‚Äì General optimizations and minor UI refinements.

‚úÖ UI/UX Enhancements ‚Äì More intuitive and user-friendly design. ‚úÖ Advanced Data Visualization ‚Äì Improved analytics and custom charts for better insights. ‚úÖ Robust Account Management ‚Äì Enhanced role-based access controls for security. ‚úÖ Follow-Up System Enhancements ‚Äì Improved UI and scheduling logic for better engagement. ‚úÖ SMS & Notifications Improvements ‚Äì Faster and more reliable SMS reminders.
‚úÖ Initial Release ‚Äì Core platform features launched, including: Client Registration & Management Encounter & Medication Tracking Reporting & Analytics User Role & Permission System

üìå A mobile application for patients that integrates seamlessly with RxKonet. üíä Easy access to prescriptions, bookings, and virtual care services for enhanced patient engagement. üè• Improves health outcomes with streamlined communication and service access.

üè• Search engine for locating medications across partnered pharmacies. üîó Supports e-referrals, e-ordering, and online booking for seamless service. ‚öñÔ∏è Ensures equitable access to medications and essential healthcare products.

üìå No archives available at this time. Past releases will be archived in future updates. üîî Stay Informed We are continuously enhancing RxKonet to meet evolving market needs. Enable notifications in your Profile Settings to receive real-time updates.
Learn how to securely access and manage your RxKonet account, update profile details, and log out safely.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to the RxKonet Login Page 2Ô∏è‚É£ Enter Your Credentials Email Address Password 3Ô∏è‚É£ Complete Two-Factor Authentication (if enabled). 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Sign In" to access your account. ‚ö° Quick Access Enable "Remember Me" on personal devices for a faster login experience.
If you can't log in: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Forgot Password". 2Ô∏è‚É£ Enter your registered email address. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Follow the password reset instructions sent to your email.

Your profile allows you to update personal information and ensure account details remain accurate. üîç Accessing Your Profile‚Äã 1Ô∏è‚É£ After logging in, click your name or profile picture in the top-right corner of the dashboard. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Select "Profile." üîÑ Updating Your Details‚Äã 1Ô∏è‚É£ Click on "Account." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Modify your email address or password. Use the "Change Password" option to update your login password. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Upload or change your profile picture. üíæ Saving Changes‚Äã ‚úÖ Click "Save" to apply updates. üõ†Ô∏è Admin-Only Fields Certain fields, such as roles and permissions, may only be editable by an administrator.
Logging out ensures your RxKonet account remains secure, especially when using shared or public devices.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Click your name or profile picture in the top-right corner. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Select "Log Out." 3Ô∏è‚É£ You will be securely logged out and redirected to the login page. üîí Security Reminder Always log out when stepping away from shared devices to prevent unauthorized access.

This section covers high-level administrative settings that affect branches, system security, communications, and user preferences. These settings may not be visible to all users but can be adjusted by authorized personnel or upon request.
Basic Details Branch name Address Contact information Operating hours Navigate to Settings > Branch Management. Select the branch you want to modify.
You can update: Basic Details: Branch name, address, contact info, and operating hours. Operational Settings: Service offerings, staff assignments, and available equipment.
Make necessary updates. Review modifications before applying. Click "Save" to confirm changes.

Modify platform-wide preferences: üåé Language Preferences ‚Äì Select default system language. ‚è≥ Time Zone & Date Format ‚Äì Adjust regional settings. üí∞ Currency Settings ‚Äì Set the preferred currency for transactions.

Enhance platform security: üîë Password Policies ‚Äì Enforce strong password rules. ‚è±Ô∏è Session Timeouts ‚Äì Auto-log out inactive users. üîê Access Restrictions ‚Äì Limit access to sensitive areas. üìú Audit Logging ‚Äì Track user actions for security monitoring. Organization Regular review of platform settings ensures optimal system performance.
This section provides guidelines on creating roles, assigning staff to branches, managing staff access, and onboarding new team members in RxKonet.

Define specific roles for your pharmacy staff, such as pharmacists, technicians, and assistants, each with different permissions. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Staff Management Click on Staff Management from the sidebar menu. Select "Create Role." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Enter Role Details Set a name for the role (e.g., Branch Manager). Select branches where this role applies. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Assign Permissions Choose access levels based on role responsibilities: Managing users, patients, encounters, and medications. Creating, updating, or deleting records. Assigning and revoking roles. Importing/exporting data. Use "Select All" for full permissions or customize individual access. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Set Global Role (Optional) Enable "Make this role global" if the role applies across all branches. 5Ô∏è‚É£ Save the Role Click "Add Role" to complete the setup.

Modify permissions, branch access, and global status as staff responsibilities change. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Staff Management Click on Staff Management from the sidebar menu. Select "Update Staff Role." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Select a Staff Member Choose the staff member whose role needs updating. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Assign a New Role Select the new role from the list. Enable Global if applicable. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Save Changes Click "Update Role" to apply the changes.

Assign staff members to one or more branches to limit access to relevant locations and patient records. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Staff Management Click on Staff Management from the sidebar menu. Select "Add Staff to a Branch." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Assign Staff to a Branch Select the staff member to assign. Choose the branch(es) where the staff will be assigned. Select the appropriate role. Enable Global if the staff should have access across all branches. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Confirm and Apply Changes Click "Add to Branch" to finalize the assignment.

Revoke branch access when a staff member transfers, resigns, or no longer needs access. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Staff Management Click on Staff Management from the sidebar menu. Select "Remove Staff from a Branch." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Select a Staff Member Choose the staff member to remove. Select the branch from which they should be removed. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Confirm and Apply Changes Click "Remove" to finalize the action.

Invite new staff members to join your pharmacy by sending an email invitation. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Staff Management Click on Staff Management from the sidebar menu. Select "Invite Staff." 2Ô∏è‚É£ Enter the Staff Member‚Äôs Email Input the email address of the new staff member. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Assign Branch and Role Select the branch(es) where the staff member will be assigned. Choose a role that determines their permissions. Enable Global if the staff should have full system-wide access. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Send the Invitation Click "Send Invite" to email the invitation. The staff member will receive an email with a link to join the organization.

Ensure staff members have appropriate access by modifying their roles, branch assignments, or permissions. ‚úÖ Updating Access‚Äã Modify role assignments. Change branch access. Adjust permissions. ‚ùå Removing Access‚Äã Revoke branch access. Deactivate accounts. Reset permissions.

Regularly review staff roles and permissions to maintain security and compliance. Quarterly reviews ensure that access is correctly assigned and only authorized users can view and modify sensitive data. üîç Best Practice Review staff permissions quarterly to ensure access levels are correctly assigned.
Learn how to group clients based on medical conditions, demographics, or specific needs to facilitate personalized communication and better patient management.

Grouping clients allows you to: ‚úÖ Improve engagement ‚Äì Send targeted health messages to specific client groups. ‚úÖ Streamline communication ‚Äì Automate appointment reminders and follow-ups. ‚úÖ Enhance care coordination ‚Äì Easily track high-priority patients (e.g., chronic disease management).
Watch this video tutorial on how to create and manage client groups in RxKonet:
documents.s: üé• Short Video on Creating Client Groups

documents.t: Click on Client Groups from the sidebar menu.

Provide a name and description for the group. Examples: üìå Diabetes Patients For medication adherence reminders for clients living with diabetes. üìå Pregnant Clients For prenatal health updates and follow-ups for expectant mothers.
Click "Create Group" to finalize the setup.

Once client groups are created, you can: ‚úÖ Send bulk SMS reminders to all members of a group. ‚úÖ Automate follow-ups based on group conditions. ‚úÖ Personalize communication by sending condition-specific updates.
Learn how to register and manage client profiles in RxKonet efficiently. This section provides a step-by-step guide to registering new clients and ensuring their information is correctly recorded.

Registering clients in RxKonet allows you to track visits, manage medical records, and communicate effectively with patients. Each registered client receives a unique membership ID for easy identification.
Navigate to Client Registration from the menu. Choose Individual registration or Bulk Import (for multiple clients).

Required Fields‚Äã These fields are mandatory to complete client registration: First Name Phone Number (with country code) Reason for First Visit Optional Fields‚Äã These fields are optional but can be added to improve record-keeping: Last Name Email Address Gender Client Group (if applicable) You can add clients to one or multiple groups if groups have been previously created in the system. Click on the Client Group dropdown and select a group or multiple groups.
Verify all information is correct before saving. Click "Register Client" to complete the process.

‚úÖ The client will be added to the Registered Clients list. ‚úÖ If configured, the client may receive a welcome message on their phone number. ‚úÖ Their profile will now be accessible for future visits and records.
If you have a list of clients that need to be added quickly, the Bulk Import feature allows you to upload multiple clients at once using a CSV or Excel file.
Navigate to Client Registration from the menu. Select the Bulk Import tab.

Click "Download Template" and choose either CSV Format or Excel Format. Open the file and fill in the required details: First Name (Required) Last Name (Optional) Email (Optional) Phone Number (Required) Gender (Optional)
Click "Choose File" and select your completed CSV/Excel file. Click "Import Clients" to upload the data.
Ensure all records are uploaded correctly by checking the Registered Clients list. If errors occur, review the file format and correct any missing or invalid data.

‚úÖ All imported clients will be added to the Registered Clients list. ‚úÖ If configured, each client may receive a welcome message confirming their registration. ‚úÖ You can now manage and update these client records as needed.

The Client Requests feature allows pharmacies to track medication or product requests made by clients. When a client requests an unavailable product, the pharmacy can log the request, update its status, and notify the client once the item is available.
‚úÖ Helps pharmacies manage out-of-stock medications ‚úÖ Provides a structured tracking system for client demands ‚úÖ Allows pharmacies to send SMS notifications when products are available
Navigate to Clients > Client Requests in the sidebar.
To add a request for a client: Click "Add Request" on the top-right corner. Select the client's name from the dropdown. Enter the product name and any additional notes. Click "Add Request" to save.

Use the search bar to find a request by client name or product. Filter by status: Requested ‚Äì The request is newly created. Available ‚Äì The product is now in stock. Collected ‚Äì The client has picked up the product. Cancelled ‚Äì The request was canceled.
To update a request: Click "View" next to a request. Change the status (e.g., "Available" when the product arrives). Optionally, send a notification to inform the client.
Once a product is available, you can notify the client via SMS: Open the request. Click "Send Notification". The client will receive an SMS alert.

‚úÖ Regularly review pending requests to ensure timely stock updates. ‚úÖ Use filters to track requests by status. ‚úÖ Always send notifications so clients are informed when their request is fulfilled.

Learn how to search, filter, and manage client records in RxKonet efficiently. This section covers how to access registered clients, customize the view, perform quick actions, and manage client history.

Efficient client record management allows pharmacists to: ‚úÖ Quickly retrieve client details for consultations. ‚úÖ Monitor visit history, medications, and diagnostics. ‚úÖ Customize the client list to display only relevant information.
Go to "Registered Clients" from the sidebar.
Search clients using multiple identifiers: üîç By Name üìû By Contact Details üè∑Ô∏è By Membership ID
Users can remove or add columns based on preference: Patient ID Name Contact Details Membership ID Visit Date Actions Click the Column Selector to modify the view.
documents.s: 3Ô∏è‚É£ Customize Columns in the Client List

documents.t: Clients' records provide multiple actions for quick access to key features: ‚úÖ Profile ‚Äì View full client details and history. ‚úÖ New Visit ‚Äì Start a new consultation or visit. ‚úÖ History ‚Äì Access previous visits, diagnoses, and medications. ‚úÖ More Actions (via the menu ... button): üè• Manage Medications ‚Äì Prescribe or modify prescriptions. ü©∫ Diagnostic Tests ‚Äì View or request lab results. ‚úâÔ∏è Messages ‚Äì Send updates and notifications. ‚è∞ Reminders ‚Äì Schedule follow-up alerts.
Watch this video tutorial on how to manage client records in RxKonet:
Learn how to update and modify client information in RxKonet to ensure accurate and up-to-date records.

Keeping client records accurate and updated is essential for quality healthcare delivery. This section guides you on how to edit personal details, medical history, contact information, emergency contacts, and insurance details.
Below is an image of the client profile page. If you want to edit a client‚Äôs profile, click on the "Edit Profile" button.
Modify basic client details: Title Gender Date of Birth Languages

Update the client‚Äôs medical history to ensure accurate treatment records: Clinical Information to add clinical details like Weight, Height, BMI, blood group, sickle cell status. History of Chronic Illness by clicking on the add sign on the far right Allergies by clicking on the add sign on the far right Lifestyle details like smoking status, alcohol use, excercise frequency and diet Social Determinants like education level, occupation etc
Keep client contact details up to date: Phone numbers Email address Residential address
Add or update emergency contact information to ensure timely communication during emergencies: Contact Name Relationship to Client Phone Number
Ensure that the client‚Äôs insurance details are correct and up to date: Insurance Provider Policy details Coverage information

‚úÖ Always verify client details during visits to prevent outdated or incorrect information. ‚úÖ Ensure emergency contacts and insurance details are accurate to avoid complications. ‚úÖ Double-check spelling and contact details for errors before saving changes. ‚úÖ Data Accuracy Regularly verify client information during visits to maintain up-to-date records.
Watch this short video tutorial on how to edit client profiles efficiently in RxKonet:
documents.s: üé• Short Recording on Editing Client Profiles

documents.t: RxKonet allows you to schedule automated SMS reminders to keep clients informed and reduce missed visits.

To access the scheduling features: Go to Communications > Schedulers Choose between: Schedule SMS Reminder ‚Äì to create a new reminder Scheduled SMS Reminders ‚Äì to view and manage existing reminders
You can send reminders to: Individual Client ‚Äì Search by name. Client Group ‚Äì Select from predefined groups (e.g., Asthmatic Patients, Family Planning Patients).
Choose a Template (optional). Enter custom message (max 160 characters). üìå You can use templates created under the "Templates" section for consistency.
Select the date and time for the message. Set Days Prior ‚Äì how many days before the appointment the reminder should go out. Choose Recurrence if the reminder should repeat (e.g., every 7 days).
Click Set Reminder to schedule the SMS.
To view, filter, or stop reminders: Go to Scheduled SMS Reminders Use filters to refine your view: Client Name Reminder Status ‚Äì Pending, Sent, or Stopped
Client Message Reminder Time Status Action Jane Doe Hello Jane Doe, Your prescription is ready... 3/21/2025, 6:00 AM Pending Stop

‚úÖ Use Client Groups for bulk scheduling. ‚úÖ Preview messages before sending to avoid typos. ‚úÖ Regularly check the Reminder List to ensure timely delivery. ‚úÖ Stop reminders when they are no longer needed.

Use the Send SMS feature in RxKonet to send appointment reminders, alerts, or follow-up instructions directly to clients via text message. ‚úÖ Helps reduce missed appointments ‚úÖ Enables quick outreach for important updates ‚úÖ Supports one-to-one and group communication
Select a message template (optional) Add a subject (optional) Type your message (Max 160 characters) üìå Variables like {Client Name} can be used in templates.
Individual Client ‚Äì Search and select a specific client All Clients ‚Äì Bulk send to all registered clients Client Group ‚Äì Send to a defined group (e.g., diabetes clinic)
SMS is the current option Email coming soon
Click Send Confirmation will show if the message is successfully sent
To review previously sent texts: Go to Communications > SMS Messages Use filters by client name, date, or status See status of each message: Sent, Failed, or Pending
Double-check the phone number before sending Keep messages brief and clear Use templates for frequently sent messages Review message logs to confirm delivery

Learn how to create and manage reusable SMS message templates for communicating with clients. RxKonet supports two types of templates: Tenant Templates ‚Äì Specific to a single branch/pharmacy. Global Templates ‚Äì Available across multiple branches managed by an organization admin.
Tenant templates are only accessible within the specific pharmacy branch where they were created.
Navigate to Communications > Templates > View Templates. Use the search bar to find templates by name or subject. Template details include: Name Subject Pharmacy Actions (View, Edit, Delete)

1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to Communications > Templates > Create Template 2Ô∏è‚É£ Fill in: Template Name Subject Message Body (max 160 characters) 3Ô∏è‚É£ Use available placeholders: {{firstName}}, {{lastName}}, {{phone}}, {{email}} {{pharmacyName}}, {{pharmacyPhone}} 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click Create Template to save. üìå Example Output: Hello {{firstName}}, your prescription is ready for pickup at {{pharmacyName}}.
Global templates are shared across multiple pharmacies managed under the same admin account.
Navigate to Communications > Templates > View Global Templates Use filters to search templates by name or category. Each template shows: Name Category Description

1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to Communications > Templates > Create Global Template 2Ô∏è‚É£ Enter: Template Name Category Description Subject Message Body (max 160 characters) 3Ô∏è‚É£ Use placeholders (same as tenant templates) 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click Create Template üîπ These templates can be imported and reused across branches.

Keep messages under 160 characters for SMS delivery. Use placeholders to personalize communication. Use tenant templates for branch-specific messages. Use global templates to ensure messaging consistency across multiple pharmacies.

RxKonet allows you to record, view, and manage diagnostic tests such as blood pressure, glucose, malaria, and more. This helps in maintaining accurate clinical records and supporting treatment decisions.
Use this when a client returns with lab results or you perform a test outside a full encounter.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Diagnostic Tests > Add Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Search for a Client ‚Äì Enter the name or phone number. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Enter Test Details: Test Type (e.g., Blood Pressure, Malaria) Test Values ‚Äì e.g., Systolic: 120, Diastolic: 80, Pulse: 72 Result ‚Äì e.g., Positive, Negative, or numeric values Notes (Optional) üìå You can add multiple tests in a session by clicking ‚ÄúAdd Another Test‚Äù. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Submit Test Result" or "Submit All Test Results" when done.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Diagnostic Tests > View Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Search for a Client ‚Äì Enter the client‚Äôs name or number 3Ô∏è‚É£ Apply Filters using: Test Type Date Range You‚Äôll see: Test type Date and time Results Notes

For numeric results (e.g., blood pressure, glucose): 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open View Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click the Actions (‚ãÆ) menu next to the test 3Ô∏è‚É£ Select "View Trends" üìà This shows graphical trends over: 24 Hours Week Month 3 Months 6 Months 1 Year This is useful for tracking chronic conditions or changes over time.
To correct or update previously recorded tests: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to View Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click Actions (‚ãÆ) > Edit 3Ô∏è‚É£ Modify the test values or notes 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click Save Changes
To remove an incorrect or duplicate entry: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to View Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click Actions (‚ãÆ) > Delete 3Ô∏è‚É£ Confirm the action
To generate a report of a client‚Äôs diagnostic results: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open View Test Results 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click Export 3Ô∏è‚É£ Choose PDF or CSV format
documents.s: üì§ Exporting Test Records (*will be available soon)

documents.t: ‚úÖ Record test results promptly for accuracy ‚úÖ Use notes to add relevant context (e.g., "normal", "needs follow-up") ‚úÖ Check for abnormal values or trends ‚úÖ Export data for review or referrals
documents.s: üìå Best Practices for Diagnostic Test Management

documents.t: Learn how to create, document, and manage patient encounters in RxKonet to ensure accurate medical records and effective follow-up care.

An encounter records a patient‚Äôs visit details, including symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up plans. This ensures comprehensive patient care and better continuity. üß† AI-powered support is available as a subscription-based add-on. Pharmacies can enable or disable these features upon request.
Go to Records & Encounters > Create Encounter.
Choose an existing client or register a new one.
Add visit date and time. Choose or type in the reason for visit.

Fill in chief complaint (e.g., "headache"). Click Generate Key Questions to see symptom-specific prompts. Use Structure Notes to convert brief entries into formal documentation. ‚úÖ AI Add-on: Speeds up history taking and improves clarity in records.

Click Suggest Relevant Tests to receive AI-driven diagnostic recommendations. Each test is tagged by priority (e.g., high, medium) and includes clinical reasoning. ‚úÖ AI Add-on: Helps select appropriate tests based on symptoms and history.

Search and add medications or enter manually. Click Generate AI Suggestions to view recommended treatments with dosage and safety info. ‚úÖ AI Add-on: Guides evidence-informed medication choices and dosing instructions.
Select Basic or Comprehensive level. Use Generate AI Recommendations to load counseling points. ‚úÖ AI Add-on: Saves time and ensures patients get complete, clear instructions.

Click on Add your first follow-up then Select method, action, date/time, and reminder frequency. Under Follow-up Plan Details, click Generate with AI to auto-fill a structured plan. You have two select either basic or comprehensive follow-up plans. ‚úÖ AI Add-on: Suggests what to monitor, when to review, and follow-up instructions.
See Viewing and Editing Encounters for more on reviewing or modifying records.
‚úÖ Document at point of care ‚úÖ Use structured notes where possible ‚úÖ Double-check AI suggestions ‚úÖ Always include follow-up plans ‚úÖ Review everything before saving
Learn how to schedule, track, and manage follow-ups for clients in RxKonet. Follow-ups help ensure consistent care, improve adherence, and reduce missed appointments.
‚úÖ Ensure timely interventions for chronic conditions ‚úÖ Monitor client progress after consultations ‚úÖ Reduce missed appointments through reminders

Navigate to Follow-Ups from the sidebar View all scheduled follow-ups Use filters to refine the list: Client Name Status: Pending, Completed, Missed Recurrence: None, Daily, Weekly, Monthly Follow-Up Type: Medication Review, Refill Reminder, etc.

Use filters to focus on follow-ups that need attention: Status: Pending Completed Missed Recurrence: None, Daily, Weekly, Monthly Follow-Up Type: Medication Review Refill Reminder Wellness Check In-Person Visit Phone Call
From the follow-up list, you can: ‚úÖ View Feedback from previous interactions ‚úÖ Reschedule follow-ups ‚úÖ Mark as Completed ‚úÖ Export to CSV for reporting
Choose which columns appear in your follow-up view: Client Name Follow-Up Type Follow-Up Time Feedback Status Recurrence Actions
Navigate to Follow-Up Analytics to track performance: Pending Follow-Ups Completed Follow-Ups Missed Follow-Ups Completion Rate

‚úÖ Set follow-ups during or after every client encounter ‚úÖ Use recurrence options for long-term treatments ‚úÖ Periodically review analytics to improve follow-up success ‚úÖ Mark completed follow-ups to keep records accurate
Learn how to access and manage previously recorded encounters in RxKonet.
Navigate to Records & Encounters > View Encounters
Search by: Client name Date Visit type
Click View next to a record to see: Date Reason for visit Symptoms Diagnostics Medications Follow-up plan

Open the desired record Make updates to any section: Symptoms & History Use Generate Key Questions for symptom-specific guidance Use Structure Notes to convert notes into structured summaries Diagnostics Click Suggest Relevant Tests to receive AI-recommended tests with priority tags Treatment Plan Use Generate AI Suggestions for evidence-informed medications and dosages Counseling Select Basic or Comprehensive and click Generate AI Recommendations Follow-up Plan Use Generate with AI to populate follow-up steps, preparation tips, and key points Click Save Encounter üß† AI features are optional add-ons, available only with subscription. Pharmacies can request to enable or disable them anytime. tip Always save any updates made to the record before moving to the next task.
‚ö†Ô∏è Deletion is Permanent Once deleted, the record cannot be restored. Steps: Click Delete next to a record Confirm the action
Learn how to track key metrics, generate reports, and analyze trends in RxKonet to improve operational efficiency and patient care.
Reports provide insights into client activity, encounters, and follow-ups to help with data-driven decision-making.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Reports Click on Reports from the sidebar. Select the desired report type. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Apply Filters Filter data by: Date Range Branch Location Follow-Up Type Status (Pending, Completed, Missed) 3Ô∏è‚É£ Generate & Export Reports Click "Generate Report" to preview the data. Choose export format: CSV or Excel.

Track activity and performance within your pharmacy. üìå Client Activity ‚Äì Monitor the number of registered clients and their engagement. üìå Encounters & Consultations ‚Äì Analyze the number of encounters recorded over time. üìå Follow-Up Reports ‚Äì Track patient follow-ups and completion status.

Analyze treatment and medication trends for better patient outcomes. üìå Medication Usage ‚Äì Monitor prescribed medications and inventory movement. üìå Follow-Up Effectiveness ‚Äì Assess the success rate of follow-up interventions. üìå Patient Outcomes ‚Äì Evaluate the results of different treatments based on encounter history.
The Analytics Dashboard provides a real-time overview of key performance metrics.

üìå Total Clients ‚Äì Number of registered clients in the system. üìå Total Encounters ‚Äì Number of consultations or visits recorded. üìå Total Messages & Reminders Sent ‚Äì Communication metrics to track engagement. üìå Pending vs. Completed Follow-Ups ‚Äì Track patient adherence to follow-up care.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Filter by Date Range View trends daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Select Follow-Up Type Filter analytics by Medication Review, Refill Reminder, In-Person Visit, etc. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Analyze Follow-Up Completion Rates View the percentage of pending, completed, and missed follow-ups. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Export Data for Further Analysis Download reports in CSV format for deeper insights.

‚úÖ Regularly check analytics to track trends and optimize performance. ‚úÖ Use filters to focus on specific follow-ups or encounters. ‚úÖ Export reports for record-keeping and strategic planning. ‚úÖ Customize dashboards to highlight the most relevant data.
RxKonet allows you to quickly add, view, and manage a patient's medications without creating a full encounter. This feature is useful for prescription updates and medication history tracking.
You can add medications to a client‚Äôs profile without needing to enter all the encounter details. This is useful when updating prescriptions or adding medications for existing clients.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Medications > Add Medications 2Ô∏è‚É£ Search for a Client ‚Äì Enter the client's name or phone number. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Enter Medication Details: Medication Name (e.g., Paracetamol) Strength (Optional, e.g., 500mg) Dosage & Frequency (e.g., 2 tablet every 8 hours) Custom Frequency (if needed) Start Date End Date (Optional) 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Add Medication" to save the prescription. üìå You can add multiple medications for a client by repeating the process.
To view medications a client is currently taking or has taken in the past:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Navigate to Medications > View Medications. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Search for a Client ‚Äì Enter the name or phone number. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Filter Medications using: Medication Name Start Date & End Date 4Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Apply Filters" to narrow the search.
You can edit an existing medication record to update dosages, frequencies, or add additional instructions.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Open the Medications list for a client. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Find the medication you want to edit. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Click the Actions (‚ãÆ) menu and select "Edit". 4Ô∏è‚É£ Update details like dosage, frequency, or instructions. 5Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Save Changes".
RxKonet allows you to resume medication reminders for clients who need notifications.

1Ô∏è‚É£ Go to Medications > View Medications. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Find the medication with an Inactive Reminder status. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Click Actions (‚ãÆ) > Resume Reminder. üìå This ensures that patients receive automated notifications about their prescriptions.

To export a client's medication history: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Open View Medications for the client. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Click "Export to download the list as a report as either a pdf or csv file. üìå This is useful for sharing medication history with healthcare providers.

‚úÖ Always verify medication details before adding or updating prescriptions. ‚úÖ Use reminder notifications to improve patient adherence. ‚úÖ Regularly review medication history for accuracy. ‚úÖ Export records when sharing prescriptions with healthcare providers.
